Post.title: ClickHouse  -  pv uv
Post._content:
> [ClickHouse ](https://clickhouse.com/docs/en/)
>
> 

 pv uv  pv uv  pv uv 

 pv uv

- 

```sql
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS test.product_operation
(
    ts_date_time  DateTime COMMENT '',
    gen_date_time DateTime COMMENT '',
    product_id    UInt64 COMMENT 'ID',
    user_id       UInt64 COMMENT 'ID',
    operation     UInt16 COMMENT '123'
) ENGINE = MergeTree()
      ORDER BY (toDate(ts_date_time), operation);
```

 [](https://clickhouse.com/docs/zh/engines/table-engines/mergetree-family/aggregatingmergetree/#ju-he-wu-hua-shi-tu-de-shi-li) 

- 

```sql
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW IF NOT EXISTS test.product_operation_day_pv_uv_mv
            ENGINE = AggregatingMergeTree()
                ORDER BY (ts_date, product_id, operation)
AS
SELECT toDate(ts_date_time)        as ts_date,
       product_id,
       operation,
       sumState(1)                 as pv,
       uniqState(user_id, ts_date) as uv
FROM test.product_operation
GROUP BY ts_date, product_id, operation;
```

- 

```sql
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW IF NOT EXISTS test.product_operation_total_pv_uv_mv
            ENGINE = AggregatingMergeTree()
                ORDER BY (product_id, operation)
AS
SELECT product_id,
       operation,
       sumState(1)        as pv,
       uniqState(user_id) as uv
FROM test.product_operation
GROUP BY product_id, operation;
```

- 

```sql
INSERT INTO test.product_operation(ts_date_time, gen_date_time, product_id, user_id, operation)
VALUES (toDateTime('2022-01-26 10:10:10'), now(), 1, 1, 1)
```

- 

> 

```sql

Kong Kong [](https://docs.konghq.com/gateway/3.3.x/)

Kong Kong 

 [quickstart](https://docs.konghq.com/gateway/3.3.x/get-started/) 



Apache  [skywalking-kong](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kong)  Kong  README 

- `luarocks install kong-skywalking --local`  `luarocks`  kong-plugin-skywalking `--tree` 
-  `kong.conf` `/etc/kong` `cp kong.conf.default kong.conf` `lua_package_path`  README 
- `/usr/local/share/lua/5.1/kong/constants.lua`  kong restart

---

 Demo Response    [API](https://docs.konghq.com/gateway/latest/plugin-development/pdk/)

 copy 



- `local BasePlugin = require "kong.plugins.base_plugin"`   BasePlugin  [2.7.x](https://docs.konghq.com/gateway/2.7.x/plugin-development/custom-logic/#migrating-from-baseplugin-module) ChatGPT 
- `kong.service.response` `kong.response`  `kong.service.response`  [kong.response](https://docs.konghq.com/gateway/latest/plugin-development/pdk/kong.response/)  `Unlike kong.service.response, this module allows mutating the response before sending it back to the client.` 

 Lua 

1.  `skywalking`  `response-handler`  Kong 
2.  `response-handler`  Lua  `handler.lua`  `schema.lua` handler  schema  Demo 

> [Plugin Configuration](https://docs.konghq.com/gateway/latest/plugin-development/configuration/)

**handler.lua** 

```
local cjson = require("cjson")

local MyPluginHandler = {
	VERSION = "0.1.0", -- 
	PRIORITY = 10 -- 
}

function MyPluginHandler:header_filter(config)
  -- 
  kong.response.set_header("Handle-Response-Header", "Response-Handler")
end

function MyPluginHandler:access(conf)
end

function MyPluginHandler:body_filter(config)
  -- 
  local response_body = kong.response.get_raw_body()
  if response_body then
     local response_json = cjson.decode(response_body)
     response_json.data.num = config.num --  response.data.num  config.num  schema.lua  config.num
     local modified_body = cjson.encode(response_json)
     kong.response.set_raw_body(modified_body)
  end
end

return MyPluginHandler
```



**schema.lua**

```
local typedefs = require "kong.db.schema.typedefs"

local PLUGIN_NAME = "myplugin"

local schema = {
  name = PLUGIN_NAME,
  fields = {
    { consumer = typedefs.no_consumer }, --  consumer
    { protocols = typedefs.protocols_http },
    { config = {
        type = "record",
        fields = { -- 
          { num = {
              type = "integer",
              default = 10,
              required = false,
              gt = 0, }}, 
        },
        entity_checks = {
          --  at_least_one_of distinct
        },
      },
    },
  },
}

return schema
```



3.  `kong.conf`   `plugins = bundled, skywalking, response-handler` 
4.  `/usr/local/share/lua/5.1/kong/constants.lua`  `local plugins = {....}`  `response-handler`
5. kong restart

 leetcode

 ""

 1:

: ""
: 
:

 a-z 
```








```
    /**
     * 
     * 
     * @param strs
     * @return
     */
    public static String longestCommonPrefix1(String[] strs) {
        if (strs.length == 0)
            return "";
        String prefix = strs[0]; // 
        for (int i = 1; i < strs.length; i++)
            while (strs[i].indexOf(prefix) != 0) { // 
                prefix = prefix.substring(0, prefix.length() - 1);
                if (prefix.isEmpty())
                    return "";
            }
        return prefix;
    }
```

Post.title: Shell
Post._content:
> 

## 






## 




```
#!/bin/bash

echo "===start==="
tt=$(date "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")
echo $tt

# kill
faceshow_pid=$(ps -ef | grep 'faceshow.jar' | grep -v grep |  awk '{print $2}')
if [ -z $faceshow_pid ] ;then
    echo "faceshow not exist"
else
    echo "faceshow_pid: $faceshow_pid"
    kill -9 ${faceshow_pid}
    echo "faceshow killed"
fi
mishow_pid=$(ps -ef | grep 'mishow.jar' | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}')
if [ -z $mishow_pid ] ;then
    echo "mishow not exist"
else
    echo "mishow_pid: $mishow_pid"
    kill -9 ${mishow_pid}
    echo "mishow killed"
fi

# start
nohup /usr/local/java/jdk1.8.0_171/bin/java -jar /usr/local/jar/faceshow.jar >/usr/local/jar/log/faceshow.log 2>&1 &
echo "faceshow restarted"

nohup /usr/local/java/jdk1.8.0_171/bin/java -jar /usr/local/jar/mishow.jar >/usr/local/jar/log/mishow.log 2>&1 &
echo "mishow restarted"

echo "===end==="

```

# ssh NAT ## 4G ip ip ssh ## - AWin 10 - BLinux ip58.247.33.44ssh 8862 - C 4G Linux ipssh 22 A BC B B CA C A C ** ssh ssh [](#)** ## ### B - sshd `vim /etc/ssh/shhd_config` vimvim vi vim [](#) - GatewayPorts ( # ) `GatewayPorts yes` - sshd () `service ssh restart` service Ubuntu `service --status-all` ### C #### `ssh -NfR 1234:localhost:22 user@58.247.33.44 -p8862` >N shell
>f
>R "::"
>p ssh
>user B
> B 1234 B C 22 "" B B 1234 1234 ssh C #### ssh ** C ** `ssh-keygen` enter `ls ~ /.ssh/` >id_rsa id_rsa.pub known_hosts `ssh-copy-id user@58.247.33.44` B B #### autossh ssh autossh autossh [](#) `autossh -M 5678 -NR 1234:localhost:22 user@58.247.33.44 -p8862` >M autossh
>autossh f C autossh #### Ubuntu 18.04 `ls /lib/systemd/system` **rc.local.service** ``` [Install] WantedBy=multi-user.target Alias=rc-local.service ``` ubuntu-18.04 /etc/rc.local ``` sudo touch /etc/rc.local chmod 755 /etc/rc.local ``` ** rc.local ** `rc.local` ** #!/bin/bash ** ``` #!/bin/bash LOG_TIME=`date "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"` echo '123456' | sudo -S autossh -M 5678 -NR 1234:localhost:2223 user@58.247.33.44 -p8862 echo "autossh restart:"$LOG_TIME >>/usr/local/autossh.log ``` root 123456 C `>>` systemd /etc/systemd/system , /etc/systemd/system `ln -s /lib/systemd/system/rc.local.service /etc/systemd/system/` ## - [sshNAT()](https://blog.csdn.net/cayman_mg/article/details/79527207) - [SSHAutossh](https://www.cnblogs.com/eshizhan/archive/2012/07/16/2592902.html) - [ubuntu-18.04 ](http://www.r9it.com/20180613/ubuntu-18.04-auto-start.html) - [ubuntu 18.04 rc.local](https://blog.csdn.net/a912952381/article/details/81205095) ## - `sudo apt-get update` - ssh `sudo apt-get install openssh-client` `sudo apt-get install openssh-server` - vim ``` sudo apt-get remove vim-common sudo apt-get install vim ``` Ubuntu 18.04 vi vim - autossh `sudo apt-get install autossh` - net-tools `ifconfig` `sudo apt install net-tools`
